sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be added to each of the numbers \(6 \), \(14 \), \(23 \), and \(29 \) to make them proportional.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{Lets suppose that the required number is $y $.

Since the numbers $6 + y $, $14 + y $, $23 + y $, $29 + y $ are in proportion, we have}$$
\[
	\frac{\input[s1v1]{} + y }{14 + y } = \frac{\input[s1v2]{} + y }{29 + y }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (6 + y )(29 + y ) = (14 + y )(23 + y )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 174 + y (\input[s2v1]{} ) + y ^2 = 322 + y (\input[s2v2]{} ) + y ^2
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow y (35 - 37 ) = 322 - 174 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow y = \frac{322 - 174 }{35 - 37 }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow y = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{\input[s3v2]{} }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow y = \frac{\input[s3v3]{} }{1 }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [6, 23], "text": "$$\text{Four numbers are proportional when $a:b::c:d$, thus, using this result we get} \frac{6 + y }{14 + y } = \frac{23 + y }{29 + y }$$"}, {"data": [35, 37], "text": " Upon cross- multiplication and further simplification we get \[
	y = \frac{322 - 174 }{35 - 37 }
\]"}, {"data": [148, -2, -74], "text": "Further simplification will give us the result as \[y= \frac{-74 }{1 }\] "}]
